com.isnotworking.recfwk.vis
Interface PlotUnivariatePerformance

All Superinterfaces:
BasicPlot
public interface PlotUnivariatePerformance
extends BasicPlot

Plots (line charts) experimental data where your have a series of performance rates and the associated value of an experiment variable. If several calls to addPerformaceSeries() are made, line charts are stacked for comparison of one performance measure against each other. If all series share the same variable, one can choose to only show the variable labels once. (values must be fed multiple times though)

Author:
ricardocabral

Method Summary
 void addPerformanceSeries(float[] variable, float[] performance, java.lang.String performanceLabel, java.lang.String variableLabel)
          Adds a series of experimental values for a given variable and their associated performance.
 void showVariableLabelOnlyOnce(boolean once)
          When stacking multiple one-variable plots where the influence of the same variable is compared against multiple performance meaures, only show the variable label once (on the lowest plot).

Method Detail

addPerformanceSeries

void addPerformanceSeries(float[] variable,
                          float[] performance,
                          java.lang.String performanceLabel,
                          java.lang.String variableLabel)
Adds a series of experimental values for a given variable and their associated performance.

Parameters:
variable - variable values. This array dimension should be equal to the performance array.
performance - performance values.
performanceLabel - performance measure name
variableLabel - variable name

showVariableLabelOnlyOnce

void showVariableLabelOnlyOnce(boolean once)
When stacking multiple one-variable plots where the influence of the same variable is compared against multiple performance meaures, only show the variable label once (on the lowest plot).

Parameters:
once - show only once.
